isis.stitle: HENDRICKSON AIR SUSPENSION WITH TRAILING LEAF SPRINGS - TORQUE RODS - REMOVE

step1.para: Remove straddle mount bar pin locknuts and washers at axle end of torque rod ( Figure 13).
Loosen rebound bolt locknut in the frame hanger.

Remove straddle mount locknuts, bolts, and washers, and any alignment shims at frame hanger ends of torque rod. Remove torque rod. Note the number of shims as they must be reinstalled in the same position to avoid affecting the axle alignment.

caution.para: Do not use heat or a cutting torch to remove the bushing from the torque rod. The use of heat will adversely affect the strength of the torque rod.

warning.para: Be sure torque rod is squarely supported on press table for safety precautions.

step1.para: Using shop press, push out old bushing. A 5 inch long with 2 inch I.D. and 1/4 inch wall steel tube tool is required. Support torque rod end on tube tool and center bushing. Push directly on bushing straddle mount bar pin until bushing clears torque rod end.
Clean and inspect I.D. of torque rod ends; remove any nicks with emery cloth.
Lubricate I.D. of torque rod ends and new rubber bushings with a vegetable base oil (cooking oil or lard). Do not use a petroleum or soap base lubricant.

note.para: Support torque rod end on receiving tool with end tube of torque rod centered on receiving tool. The straddle mounted bar pin bushing must have flats positioned ten degrees counterclockwise to shank of torque rod as shown in Figure 9. Press directly on straddle mount bar pin bushing. Bushing must be centered within torque rod end tubes. When pressing in new bushings, press past desired final position by approximately 3/16 inch and press bushing again from opposite side to center bushing within torque rod end.

warning.para: Be sure torque rod is squarely supported on press table for safety precautions.
